intro: Glochidion goniocarpum, commonly known as the oval-leaf glochidion, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and often ovate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by distinctive glochidiate (spiny) fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of tropical understory ecosystems.
